passages.text: Q2 results exceed expectations; focus to remain on Pekao merger - first ta

Our Take: PZU's Q2 net profit reached PLN 1.47bn, marking a 23% YoY increase and surpassing the company- compiled consensus by 3%. This positive result was primarily driven by a 32% increase in insurance operations, which constitute 64% of the group's earnings. The banking operations, including Pekao and Alior, which account for 36% of the group's earnings, had a 10% rise in earnings. Within insurance activities, insurance service result (underwriting result) saw a 11% increase, with the Poland non- life insurance combined ratio improving from 95% in Q2 2024 to 93% currently. Meanwhile, Poland life insurance maintained a strong profit margin of 26%, unchanged YoY, and had positive growth of 2% in the contractual service margin (CSM). Results from investment activities allocated to the insurance segment rose by 24%, further bolstering earnings. Overall, we view these results positively for PZU, although we maintain a Neutral rating on the stock, as we find limited upside potential for the shares at this time. We believe investor focus will remain on the execution of the proposed merger with Pekao, and we look forward to the earnings call at 13:00 CET for more details.

Noteworthy Areas: 1) The insurance revenue for PZU Group in the first half of 2025 reached PLN 15.2 billion, with significant growth in non- motor insurance, particularly in TPL insurance and fire and property damage insurance. 2) The Q2 combined ratio of 95% is trending above management's target of \(CurrentHist %Rank (1=Top)Quant Factors%Rank6M1Y3Y5YValue7659596717Growth3426511751Momentum5126672659Quality3493499Low Vol917111ESGQ144938323

PZU benefits from its leading market position in insurance in Poland, where its profit margins are above those of peers. It has a robust balance sheet and solvency position, which enhances its ability to underwrite insurance risks, withstand economic fluctuations and continue paying dividends at an attractive yield, which would move to c. \(10\%\) at the upper end of management's payout target range of \(80\%\) . PZU has an extensive distribution network including agents, brokers and bancassurance through its controlling stakes in two Polish banks (Alior and Pekao). Historically, its non- life insurance business has been key while life insurance was softer. More recently, however, the life business has been more steady and non- life under more pressure. Current earnings at the banks also appear unsustainable high due to elevated interest rates and are likely to reduce in 2026. We rate the stock Neutral.
Our price target is derived from a SOTP approach by capitalising forecast earnings on PE multiples. We use the CAPM model to estimate a \(12\%\) cost of equity for the Polish businesses.

PZU (Neutral; Price Target: zl62.00)

PZU benefits from its leading market position in insurance in Poland, where its profit margins are above those of peers. It has a robust balance sheet and solvency position, which enhances its ability to underwrite insurance risks, withstand economic fluctuations and continue paying dividends at an attractive yield, which would move to c. \(10\%\) at the upper end of management's payout target range of \(80\%\) . PZU has an extensive distribution network including agents, brokers and bancassurance through its controlling stakes in two Polish banks (Alior and Pekao). Historically, its non- life insurance business has been key while life insurance was softer. More recently, however, the life business has been more steady and non- life under more pressure. Current earnings at the banks also appear unsustainably high due to elevated interest rates and are likely to reduce in 2026. We rate the stock Neutral.
Our price target is derived from a SOTP approach by capitalising forecast earnings on PE multiples. We use the CAPM model to estimate a \(12\%\) cost of equity for the Polish businesses.

All authors named within this report are Research Analysts who produce independent research unless otherwise specified. In Europe, Sector Specialists (Sales and Trading) may be shown on this report as contacts but are not authors of the report or part of the Research Department.

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the

price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
